message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Our analysis is based on household survey data from the National Statistics Office (NSO) of the Philippines and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program datasets, which cover various years in this period.", "dataset": ["National Statistics Office (NSO) of the Philippines", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program datasets"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses the World Bank database on fiscal decentralization around the world to create a panel dataset for 103 countries over the period 1993-2014.", "dataset": ["World Bank database on fiscal decentralization around the world"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Our study combines information from multiple data sources including population-based surveys, administrative records, and medical records.", "dataset": ["population-based surveys", "administrative records", "medical records"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Employer Identification Number (EIN) system in the U.S. Social Security Administration's Business Register and county-level characteristics from the County Business Patterns dataset.", "dataset": ["Employer Identification Number (EIN) system in the U.S. Social Security Administration's Business Register", "County Business Patterns dataset"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper leverages new digitized historical economic data and complementary statistical and legal government records available at the local level to reconstruct Bolivian municipalities' economic history.", "dataset": ["new digitized historical economic data", "complementary statistical and legal government records"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We used nationally representative data from the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) program conducted in several West African countries with high rates of child marriage and adolescent fertility.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) program"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "In our analysis of the relationship between credit growth and real estate prices, we use data from a unique panel dataset on European commercial properties from 2004-2016, as well as complementary macroeconomic data from the World Bank.", "dataset": ["unique panel dataset on European commercial properties", "macroeconomic data from the World Bank"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Our study uses the World Bank's IDA resource allocation formula to simulate the impact of reallocating resources in different ways, drawing on annual panel data from 2007 to 2019 for all IDA countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's IDA resource allocation formula", "annual panel data from 2007 to 2019 for all IDA countries"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using detailed data on expenditures from the Colombian government's Sistema Integrado de Información Financiera (Integrated Financial Information System), this paper estimates cost functions for public schools across different municipalities.", "dataset": ["Colombian government's Sistema Integrado de Información Financiera (Integrated Financial Information System)"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data sets from the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) reporting platform and from Bitcointicker.co to observe how changes in global temperature indices affect Bitcoin price movements during two specific periods of historical events, i.e., the Paris climate agreement signing and the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak.", "dataset": ["United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) reporting platform", "Bitcointicker.co"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Digital Development"]}]
